intro: Eriogonum taxifolium, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate yellow flowers and fern-like, finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and plains. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and has a deep root system that helps it survive in arid conditions. Eriogonum taxifolium is often found in disturbed soils and is an important plant for local pollinators.
